Description: Tondo sherd with turn of stem of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly a Siana cup; interior: tondo border of alternating added red and dilute brown tongues, with four black and one red band on the inside; in the tondo, blac- figure decoration consisting of parts of two cocks (tail feathers, alternating red and black, of one to right and head with red comb and wattle of second, to left); at right, a lotus bud; exterior: glazed black with start of stem.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the subject, see ABV, 57, no. 108.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 380, no. B531)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0401) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
